orderBy.description:
Specifies the order by criteria. The syntax of this parameter is
similar to the syntax of the `order by` clause of an SQL statement.
Each query can be ordered by any of the following `kafkaRequests` fields:

* bootstrap_server_host
* admin_api_server_url
* cloud_provider
* cluster_id
* created_at
* href
* id
* instance_type
* multi_az
* name
* organisation_id
* owner
* reauthentication_enabled
* region
* status
* updated_at
* version

For example, to return all Kafka instances ordered by their name, use the following syntax:

```sql
name asc
```

To return all Kafka instances ordered by their name _and_ created date, use the following syntax:

```sql
name asc, created_at asc
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then
the results are ordered by name.
orderBy.name: orderBy

search.description:
Search criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the `where` clause of an
SQL statement. Allowed fields in the search are `cloud_provider`, `name`, `owner`, `region`, `status` and `cluster_id`. Allowed comparators are `<>`, `=`, `LIKE`, or `ILIKE`.
Allowed joins are `AND` and `OR`. However, you can use a maximum of 10 joins in a search query.

Examples:

To return a Kafka instance with the name `my-kafka` and the region `aws`, use the following syntax:

```
name = my-kafka and cloud_provider = aws
```

To return a Kafka instance with a name that starts with `my`, use the following syntax:

```
name like my%25
```

To return a Kafka instance with a name containing `test` matching any character case combinations, use the following syntax:

```
name ilike %25test%25
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then all the Kafka instances
that the user has permission to see are returned.

Note. If the query is invalid, an error is returned.
search.name: search

size.description: Number of items in each page
size.name: size

EnterpriseOsdClusterPayload.description: Schema for the request body sent to /clusters POST

access_kafkas_via_private_network.description: Sets whether Kafkas created on this data plane cluster have to be accessed via private network

cluster_id.description: The data plane cluster ID. This is the ID of the cluster obtained from OpenShift Cluster Manager (OCM) API

cluster_ingress_dns_name.description: dns name of the cluster. Can be obtained from the response JSON of the /api/clusters_mgmt/v1/clusters/<cluster_id>/ingresses (dns_name)

kafka_machine_pool_node_count.description:
The node count given to the created kafka machine pool. 
The machine pool must be created via /api/clusters_mgmt/v1/clusters/<cluster_id>/machine_pools prior to passing this value.
The created machine pool must have a `bf2.org/kafkaInstanceProfileType=standard` label and a `bf2.org/kafkaInstanceProfileType=standard:NoExecute` taint.
The name of the machine pool must be `kafka-standard` 
The node count value has to be a multiple of 3 with a minimum of 3 nodes.

href.description: The absolute path of the resource

id.description: The unique and immutable identifier of the resource

operation_id.description: Relatively unique operation ID of the request associated to the error

reason.description: Human-readable description of the error. Intended for human consumption

FleetshardParameter.description: Fleetshard parameter consumed by enterprise cluster

desired_billing_cloud_account_id.description: The desired Kafka billing cloud account ID to promote the kafka instance to. Only considered when desired_kafka_billing_model is 'marketplace'

desired_kafka_billing_model.description: The desired Kafka billing model to promote the kafka instance to. Promotion is performed asynchronously. Accepted values: ['marketplace', 'standard']

desired_marketplace.description: The desired billing marketplace to promote the kafka instance to. Accepted values: ['aws', 'rhm']. Only considered when desired_kafka_billing_model is 'marketplace'

admin_api_server_url.description: The kafka admin server url to perform kafka admin operations e.g acl management etc. The value will be available when the Kafka has been fully provisioned i.e it reaches a 'ready' state

cloud_provider.description: Name of Cloud used to deploy. For example AWS

cluster_id.description: The ID of the data plane where Kafka is deployed on. This information is only returned for kafka whose billing model is enterprise

egress_throughput_per_sec.description: This field is now deprecated, please use the /api/kafkas_mgmt/v1/instance_types/{cloud_provider}/{cloud_region} endpoint to retrieve the field instead.

ingress_throughput_per_sec.description: This field is now deprecated, please use the /api/kafkas_mgmt/v1/instance_types/{cloud_provider}/{cloud_region} endpoint to retrieve the field instead.

instance_type_name.description: This field is now deprecated, please use the /api/kafkas_mgmt/v1/instance_types/{cloud_provider}/{cloud_region} endpoint to retrieve the field instead.

kafka_storage_size.description: Maximum data storage available to this Kafka. This is now deprecated, please use max_data_retention_size instead.

max_connection_attempts_per_sec.description: This field is now deprecated, please use the /api/kafkas_mgmt/v1/instance_types/{cloud_provider}/{cloud_region} endpoint to retrieve the field instead.

max_data_retention_period.description: This field is now deprecated, please use the /api/kafkas_mgmt/v1/instance_types/{cloud_provider}/{cloud_region} endpoint to retrieve the field instead.

max_partitions.description: This field is now deprecated, please use the /api/kafkas_mgmt/v1/instance_types/{cloud_provider}/{cloud_region} endpoint to retrieve the field instead.

promotion_details.description: Details of the Kafka request promotion. It can be set when a Kafka request promotion is in progress or has failed

promotion_status.description: Status of the Kafka request promotion. Possible values: ['promoting', 'failed']. If unset it means no promotion is in progress.

region.description: Values will be regions of specific cloud provider. For example: us-east-1 for AWS

status.description: Values: [accepted, preparing, provisioning, ready, failed, deprovision, deleting, suspending, suspended, resuming]

total_max_connections.description: This field is now deprecated, please use the /api/kafkas_mgmt/v1/instance_types/{cloud_provider}/{cloud_region} endpoint to retrieve the field instead.

KafkaRequestPayload.description: Schema for the request body sent to /kafkas POST

billing_cloud_account_id.description: cloud account id used to purchase the instance

cloud_provider.description: The cloud provider where the Kafka cluster will be created in

cluster_id.description: enterprise OSD cluster ID to be used for kafka creation

marketplace.description: marketplace where the instance is purchased on

name.description: The name of the Kafka cluster. It must consist of lower-case alphanumeric characters or '-', start with an alphabetic character, and end with an alphanumeric character, and can not be longer than 32 characters.

plan.description: kafka plan in a format of <instance_type>.<size_id>

reauthentication_enabled.description: Whether connection reauthentication is enabled or not. If set to true, connection reauthentication on the Kafka instance will be required every 5 minutes. The default value is true

region.description: The region where the Kafka cluster will be created in

reauthentication_enabled.description: Whether connection reauthentication is enabled or not. If set to true, connection reauthentication on the Kafka instance will be required every 5 minutes.

RegionCapacityListItem.description: schema for a kafka instance type capacity in region

available_sizes.description: list of available Kafka instance sizes that can be created in this region when taking account current capacity and regional limits

id.description: server generated unique id of the service account

ServiceAccount.description: Service Account created in MAS-SSO for the Kafka Cluster for authentication

client_id.description: client id of the service account

created_by.description: service account created by the user

id.description: server generated unique id of the service account

ServiceAccountRequest.description: Schema for the request to create a service account

description.description: A description for the service account

name.description: The name of the service account

ams_billing_models.description: List of AMS available billing models: Accepted values: ['marketplace', 'marketplace-rhm', 'marketplace-aws']

ams_product.description: AMS product to be used. Accepted values: ['RHOSAK', 'RHOSAKTrial', 'RHOSAKEval', 'RHOSAKCC']

ams_resource.description: AMS resource to be used. Accepted values: ['rhosak']

id.description: Identifier for the Kafka billing model

display_name.description: Human readable name of the supported Kafka instance type

id.description: Unique identifier of the Kafka instance type.

sizes.description: A list of Kafka instance sizes available for this instance type

supported_billing_models.description: A list of available kafka billing models for the instance type. Each kafka billing model item has a unique 'id'

capacity_consumed.description: Data plane cluster capacity consumed by this Kafka instance size.

display_name.description: Display name of this Kafka instance size.

egress_throughput_per_sec.description: Maximum egress throughput per second available to this Kafka instance size.

id.description: Unique identifier of this Kafka instance size.

ingress_throughput_per_sec.description: Maximum ingress throughput per second available to this Kafka instance size.

lifespan_seconds.description: The limit lifespan of the kafka instance in seconds. If not specified then the instance never expires.

maturity_status.description: Maturity level of the size. Can be "stable" or "preview".

max_connection_attempts_per_sec.description: Maximium connection attempts per second available to this Kafka instance size.

max_data_retention_period.description: Maximum data retention period available to this Kafka instance size.

max_data_retention_size.description: Maximum data storage available to this Kafka instance size.

max_message_size.description: Maximum message size available to this Kafka instance size.

max_partitions.description: Maximum amount of total partitions available to this Kafka instance size.

quota_consumed.description: Quota consumed by this Kafka instance size.

quota_type.description: Quota type used by this Kafka instance size. This is now deprecated, please refer to supported_billing_models at instance-type level instead.

replication_factor.description: Replication factor available to this Kafka instance size.

supported_az_modes.description: List of Availability Zone modes that this Kafka instance size supports. The possible values are "single", "multi".

total_max_connections.description: Maximum amount of total connections available to this Kafka instance size.
